hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I'd like to take the job drugs facts and comparisons book online Back in London Polman told me how philanthropy too can deliver extra sales. It’s not PR, he said, it’s a new business model. So he funds a Domestos Toilet Academy in Vietnam, which trains local entrepreneurs to install latrines. This capitalist complement to the communist government’s Patriotic Hygiene Movement 'will sell more soap and toilet cleaners when people have toilets’. Similarly, he is selling a billion Pure-it water purification kits in India 'at no profit’. The kits prevent people with dodgy water supplies from getting diarrhoea (the world’s second biggest killer of children, after pneumonia). They require '80 per cent less carbon emissions than boiled or bottled water’ and 'in the end, they will buy our toothpaste and soap’.
